channel.title: Item codes dont seem to be working
channel.description:
Hey i just wanna start off with that yes i am a new member here :). But my problem is that item codes aren't working on my moparscape client.
"::pickup<space>(item id)<space>(amount you want)" is still the way you do it right? :confused:
oh, and i would also like to now how to make npc's :D. THANKS FOR R33DING~

item.title: Item codes dont seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @mod_lol1 mod_lol1
item.description:
@mod_lol1 wrote:

in the download section u can get a client.

item.title: Item codes dont seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @Flash155 Flash155
item.description:
@Flash155 wrote:

[quote=“lolwut44, post:16, topic:264590”][quote author=Flash155 link=topic=349389.msg2685908#msg2685908 date=1235677457]
can u teach me?
[/quote]HAHAHAHAHA!!! You don’t know how to open a file!!!.. Give up on making a private server if you can’t even open a file…

[quote author=Flash155 link=topic=349389.msg2685911#msg2685911 date=1235677548]
but the client document isnt in my moparscape folder tho…
[/quote]1) moparscape is a CLOSED SOURCE client, it doesn’t have any source code, just bytecode. 2) Why are you trying to open a server-sided file on the client side? 3) Give up.[/quote]

Then were do i get a client? ;D

I came here to learn, not to be harassed :mad:

Read full topic

err okay…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 26, 2009, 01:30:19 pm[/size][hr]It says that a class is: A class is a blueprint or prototype from which objects are created. This section defines a class that models the state and behavior of a real-world object. It intentionally focuses on the basics, showing how even a simple class can cleanly model state and behavior.

But how do i make a “class”?

item.source: Item codes dont seem to be working

item.title: Item codes dont seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Pickup command -

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } else { sendMessage("Type ::pickup 995 100 for 100 GP."); } } }

For NPC’s, autospawn configuration file.

Read full topic
